intro: Psychotria acicularis, commonly known as the "arrow poison plant," is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant contains various alkaloids, including psychotrine, which has been historically used by indigenous peoples for ritual and medicinal purposes. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its toxic properties, it is typically handled with caution.
